lines.text: Dear God, I accept my death gladly but do not let me suffer too long. Will I be with You tonight in Paradise?
That has nothing to do with this trial!
You claim that I am sent by the Devil. It's not true. To make me suffer, the Devil has sent you... and you... and you... and you.
To save France - it's why I was born.

[counts on her fingers]
Nineteen... I think.
In France, I am called Joan... in my village, I am called Jeanneton.
I swear to tell the truth, the whole truth, nothing but the truth.
So you think God hates the English?
I don't know if God loves or hates the English; but I do know that the English will all be chased from France - except those that die here!
Why do you wear men's clothing? If we give you woman's clothing, would you wear it?
When the mission that God has entrusted to me is over, I will again dress as a woman.
How do you know a good angel from an evil angel?
I love and honor God... with al my heart.
